statement.p: In the following questions, we investigate how \log_{10}(a \cdot b) can be equivalently written in terms of \log_{10}(a) and \log_{10}(b).

ol.label: a.

li.p: What is the simplest possible way to write \log_{10}10^x? What about the simplest equivalent expression for \log_{10}10^y?

Explain why each of the following equalities hold:
\log_{10}(10^x \cdot 10^y) &= \log_{10}(10^{x+y}) &= x+y &= \log_{10}(10^x) + \log_{10}(10^x) .

ol.li: Suppose that a and b are positive real numbers, so we can think of a as 10^x for some real number x and b as 10^y for some real number y. That is, say that a = 10^x and b = 10^y. What does our work in (c) tell us about \log_{10}(ab)?
